intro: Oxyspora paniculata var. paniculata, commonly known as the panicled oxyspora, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces panicles of small, yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for garden landscapes.
